title: 110_s3731
content:
The Act is titled as the "Special Inspector General for the Troubled Asset Relief Program Act of 2008" and grants audit and investigation authorities. SEC. 2 amends the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 to grant the Special Inspector General authority to conduct audits and investigations. SEC. 3 addresses personnel authorities. The Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 is amended to grant the Special Inspector General authority to exercise certain employment authorities. The Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 grants the Special Inspector General authority over employment appointments, with no appointment exceeding the termination date of the Office of the Special Inspector General. SEC. 4. RESPONSE TO AUDITS AND COOPERATION AND COORDINATION WITH OTHER ENTITIES. Section 121 of the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 is amended to include provisions for corrective responses to audit problems and cooperation with other entities to avoid duplication of effort. The Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 is amended to include provisions for oversight of the Troubled Asset Relief Program by various Inspector Generals to avoid duplication of effort. SEC. 5. REPORTING REQUIREMENTS.

The Special Inspector General must submit a report to Congress by July 1, 2009, analyzing the use of TARP funds by financial institutions. The report must be made public within 24 hours of submission. All reports submitted under this subsection will be available to the public.

SEC. 6. FUNDING OF THE OFFICE OF THE SPECIAL INSPECTOR GENERAL. SEC. 6. FUNDING OF THE OFFICE OF THE SPECIAL INSPECTOR GENERAL. Amendment to the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 regarding funding for the Special Inspector General, with a deadline for confirmation by the Senate.
